name: SPHEREX
goals: Survey the sky in infrared to study the origins of the universe and search for water in young stars

name: Xuntian
goals: Provide high-resolution images of the universe, complementing the Hubble Space Telescope

name: Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope
goals: Study dark energy and exoplanets with a wide-field view

name: Astrosat-2
goals: Multi-wavelength observations of the universe

name: Spektr-UV (WSO-UV)
goals: Study the ultraviolet spectra of celestial objects

name: PLATO
goals: Discover and characterize exoplanets, focusing on Earth-sized planets in the habitable zone

name: LiteBIRD
goals: Study the polarization of the cosmic microwave background to probe the inflationary epoch of the universe

name: ARIEL
goals: Study the atmospheres of exoplanets to understand their composition and conditions

name: ATHENA
target: Hot and energetic phenomena in the universe
goals: Investigate the hot and energetic universe, including black holes, galaxy clusters, and supernova remnants

name: LISA
target: Massive black holes, binary star systems
goals: Detect gravitational waves from space to study the universe’s most massive objects and events

name: Future Great Observatory 1
goals: Successor to Hubble, Spitzer, and Chandra, with advanced capabilities

name: Future Great Observatory 2
goals: Successor to Hubble, Spitzer, and Chandra, with advanced capabilities

name: Future Great Observatory 3
goals: Successor to Hubble, Spitzer, and Chandra, with advanced capabilities

name: X-ray Polarimeter Satellite (XPoSat)
goals: Study polarization of X-rays from celestial sources

name: Aditya L1
goals: Study the Sun’s corona, chromosphere, and photosphere

name: TOLIMAN
goals: Search for potentially habitable exoplanets

name: International Lunar Observatory Precursor (ILO-X)
goals: Conduct astronomical observations from the Moon

name: XRISM
goals: Study hot plasma in galaxies and galaxy clusters

name: Euclid
goals: Study dark matter and dark energy

name: SVOM
goals: Detect and study gamma-ray bursts
